Articles.Content:
[![464280KerbalWorLdSearchRVB900.jpg](http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/464280KerbalWorLdSearchRVB900.jpg)](http://www.hostingpics.net/viewer.php?id=464280KerbalWorLdSearchRVB900.jpg)

Ready-to-print, 300 dpi, A4, CMYK version can be found [here](http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/393103KerbalWorLdSearchCMJNPRINT.jpg).

Have fun.

Here is the solution :

![944056KerbalWorLdSearchsolutionRVB900.jpg](http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/944056KerbalWorLdSearchsolutionRVB900.jpg)

And again, a ready-to-print, 300 dpi, A4, CMYK version of the solution can be found [here](http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/356866KerbalWorLdSearchsolutionCMJNPRINT.jpg).

Cheers !

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-30T14:23:35Z" title="06/30/2015 02:23  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 30, 2015</time> by Plume & Akakak**

cool ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

how many time you took to do it?

This is really neat. Having that perspective effect actually makes this rather unique. I don't think I have seen a wordsearch with perspective before.

Having the unused letters spell something is a great touch.

Thanks EdusacconBR !

Answering your question : quite a lot.

But when there's no deadline, one should take the opportunity to work comfortably slow : ).

+EDIT : and thanks wossname !

Yep, KSP is a 3D thing. We probably all remember how disorientated we felt when we sent a kerbal out in space for the first time. So I thought I could add a touch of disturbing depth to this puzzle.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-29T20:29:42Z" title="06/29/2015 08:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 29, 2015</time> by Plume & Akakak**

How could I be so stupid all my life.

I only just now realized there is an efficient way of searching for words in word searches. Skim all of the diagonals, vertical,s and horizontals. You don't have to search blindly.

> 
> How could I be so stupid all my life.
> I only just now realized there is an efficient way of searching for words in word searches. Skim all of the diagonals, vertical,s and horizontals. You don't have to search blindly.

I know that feeling. I can now open a pack of biscuits by pulling the tab.
